name: Tambopata Eco Lodge

reviews.text: We stayed here for 2 nites as part of our Peru trip with the excellent GAP Adventures.
reviews.title: Once in a lifetime experience

likes.liked: — The complete remoteness of the place and the incredible setting

reviews.text: It is a trek to get here, a 1 hour flight from Cusco to Puerto Maldonado, 20 minutes to the little port and then a 3 hour boatride down the Tambopata river, but the scenery along the way is breathtaking..the river is a mile wide in places, with the Amazon rainforest on either side...surreal really..
reviews.title: An interesting stay in the Amazon Jungle

reviews.text: And the trek is more than worth it, because this place is very special. There are about 20 little lodges set around the main building, in the most idyllic forest setting you could imagine. OK, the lodges dont have electricity yet, just candles, but they have hot(ish) water, are comfortable and are designed perfectly for the setting they are in.. i mean you wouldnt really want a 20 storey hotel with heated swimming pool and underground carpark here !!..and solar electricity is on the way..
reviews.title: Great Eco Lodge

likes.disliked: — you're able to hear your neighbor in the adjoining room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff and guides are brilliant...Juan Carlos was a superb and knowledgable guide, with a great sense of humour..he brought us on some lovely jungle walks, and even though it was teeming rain on one particular walk, it kinda added to the authenticity..
reviews.title: Luxury in the Jungle

likes.liked: — Luxurious accommodation in such a remote location.

reviews.text: ..we were the only group there when we stayed which added to the "away from civilisation" feeling the place had. The food was incredibly tasty, home cooked, and in a lovely setting in the rustic log cabin...
reviews.title: Welcome to the Jungle!

aka: Tambopata Eco Hotel Tambopata National Reserve
